text: It's very late. It's quiet. Just the sounds of The City LINDA SANTANA CRAIG, an attractive Hispanic woman in her thirties, waits at the ELEVATED STATION for the F train. Linda looks great. She's dressed festively but tastefully Next to her is her eleven year old DAUGHTER, ALICIA. She twirling about the platform, still jazzed from the birthd party they attended in The City. Alicia wears a black dress with a pink cardigan and has a handbag. We notice a CHARM BRACELET with four-leaf clover her right wrist. The mother and daughter wait alone at one end of the stat platform. TWO TEENAGE BOYS wait at the other end. They speak soft, SLURRED SPANISH to each other. Linda gives the boys a glance and evaluates. She watches as Alicia spits a wad of gum into her mom's open hand. The Boys approach. Linda tenses. At the last second the b make a hard left turn and disappear down the stairwell. I quiet again. Linda relaxes, smiles at her daughter. The F TRAIN is rounding the final bend into the station. Their focus is on this train. It's getting closer, louder And so they don't see, don't hear the Boys coming back up stairwell behind them. Not until the boys have the mother and daughter boxed in the one who can hardly grow a mustache is showing them hi gun. Linda puts her arm around her daughter. Alicia looks terrified. The train roars INTO THE STATION as Linda quickly hands o her purse, her watch. She hands over her engagement ring her wedding band. One of the boys yanks Alicia's little purse away from her The other boy fumbles the wedding band. The ring CLANGS t the ground and rolls to a stop a few feet away. We hear MEN'S VOICES echoing up the stairwell. Now the Boys are boxed in. And starting to panic.

The Boys see their way out and step into the last empty r car, leaving the mother and daughter alone on the platfor Through the window on the train, Linda stares at the boy holding her daughter's purse, her face hardening into a M OF CONTEMPT. The boy clocks it. Who does she think she is?

When a HAND WITH TATTOOED KNUCKLES reaches out and stops car doors from closing. A forearm and gun extend out of that last subway car ... There's a muzzle flash... a distant POP... a cloud of smo ... a mist of blood... and Linda's body collapses on itse Alicia's face, shock, terror and blood. 2   EXT. SMITH STREET STATION -- LATER THAT NIGHT --   M. A WORKING CRIME SCENE, lots of uniforms and light, a whit sheet draped over Linda's body where it fell. BLUE AND RED LIGHT dances against the stairwell wall wher man is taking the stairs two at a time. Late thirties, bi plain clothes, he is SERGEANT JAMES CRAIG. When he reache the platform, he stops. Craig kneels before the white sheet. Peels it back. We st on him. We don't see what he sees. We just see how he see it. Then he turns... THE WEDDING BAND. It's been tagged and numbered as eviden Craig picks it right out of the chalk outline and slips i into his pocket. Alicia, wrapped in a blanket, standing next to a round po MATRON. The Matron is tenderly trying to clean Alicia's f Alicia locks eyes with Craig and stumbles towards him, he legs not quite working. Craig saves her from the stumble and envelops her, liftin her as the blanket falls to the ground. Alicia makes little gasping noises. Trying to speak but can't. Craig walking back now, carrying his entire world. He rea the stairwell and suddenly falls to one knee. Alicia gasp

The closest UNIFORM puts a hand on his arm. A moment. Composure. A deep breath. Then as quickly as he went down he's back up. Craig looks back now, taking it all in. Is it real? Sees the cops looking at him, then begins down the stairs. WE DRIFT UP above the station until we find ourselves wit clear view of the southern tip of Manhattan, where the TW TOWERS STAND TALL.

SUBTITLE: "Eight Years Later" Tiny kitchen, clutter, a MESSENGER BIKE hanging from hook the wall, a lot of books. There is a PHONE RINGING under bed. TYLER ROTH, early twenties, handsome, looking haggard. He sitting on the floor, shirtless, bed head, wrapped in a blanket. A GUITAR is on his lap. Tyler has propped some w worn, hand written pages of MUSIC against a box of off-br laundry detergent and is squinting at the notes, frustrat etched in his face. A forgettable BLONDE lies sleeping on the bed. Tyler, not a born musician, is trying to teach himself on the PHRASES OF MUSIC in front of him. He is completely lo in the moment, with DEEP GROOVES in his fingers. By the ASHTRAY next to him, we can tell he's been at this a coup of hours. The Blonde in the bed re: the ringing phone...
(out of it)
Hello? Tyler gropes around the floor with one hand until he find phone, simultaneously glancing at the digital clock. His widen in alarm.
Yeah... (listens)

Of course. I'm on my way. I know...I know...I know...I know. Tyler climbs out of his blanket and yanks on a pair of da suit pants. Before he pulls on his white undershirt we observe a TATTOO that simply says "Michael" over his hear
He searches through a beat-up chest of drawers, seeking a reasonably clean button down shirt...

Gandhi said that whatever you do in life will be insignificant but it is very important that you do it... ...And scrubs at a mysterious stain on the shoulder of an expensive but worn to hell suit jacket with a dishwasher brush.
...I tend to agree with the first part.

A cluster of MOURNERS stand before a tombstone in the distance. They are not in funeral dress, as this is not a funeral. It's a memorial. A beat up GYPSY CAB with a WEST INDIAN DRIVER pulls to a stop. From the trees and the sky we know its LATE SPRING/EARLY SUMMER. A gorgeous day. Tyler gets out of the cab, holding the rim of his empty coffee cup in his teeth. He sorts a rumpled wad of single and hands some to the driver, who screeches into reverse. Time is money. Tyler crushes the coffee cup flat and slips it in his jac pocket then lights up a smoke. He takes one long drag the extinguishes it and slips the butt into his pocket. He be towards the mourners. His mother... DIANE HOFFMAN, a beauty. Past burdens etche the lines on her face. Dressed tastefully in expensive bohemian. She smiles like someone who's been crying but doesn't want anyone to know she has.
(sweetly)
Hello, your majesty. How are you?

I'm fine... you look good... He kisses his mother's hand and he's moving to greet his stepfather... LES HOFFMAN, Unruly curls streaked in gray, tweed jacket tie. They exchange a firm handshake and muttered hellos.
The weight of Tyler's gaze falls to CAROLINE ROTH, his diminutive bespectacled, eleven year old sister. She's holding a little paper bag. She flashes him a look. He kneels besides her and whisper
Thanks for organizing everybody. Caroline makes a face. Turns her nose away from him.

You smell like Listerine and beer. He snorts and kisses her cheek. Caroline reaches into her bag and takes out a handful of smooth white stones, on which she has painted the names: "Mom" "Tyler" "Les", "Dad", "Caroline". She begins to arr them in a little circle on the grave. Tyler's father... CHARLES ROTH, late fifties, breathes power, precisely dressed, two hundred dollar haircut. A predator.
(aside, to Tyler)
You couldn't wear a tie? Tyler holds his father's eye.

Could have. Beat. Charles adjusts his own collar like it's an explosive. POV: The Tombstone. The four adult family members stand s by-side. They look like strangers on the subway as Caroli sits on the ground, arranging the stones.

The family sits together in a booth. Tyler rolls a Bic lighter over his knuckles. Caroline draws a funny portrai Tyler on her napkin. He is smoking nine cigarettes at onc Diane gives the menu a ridiculous amount of attention. Le eyeing the Cheesecake. Charles subtly aligns his silverwa
DIANE
...This is nice... I think it's nice that we still do this...
(gently) Mom. DIANE

I forgot. I'm trying to purge "nice" from my vocabulary. Michael would like that we still do this. Tyler takes out a cigarette. Lights it. Without saying a his mother takes it and snubs it out in an empty water gl DIANE

(to Caroline) Did you tell Tyler what your art teacher said about your portrait? Caroline, as bemused as an eleven year old can be, looks her mother, then at her brother. She adopts a very mother tone. CAROLINE
Tyler, did I tell you what my art teacher said about my portrait? TYLER
Why no, Caroline. What did your art teacher say about your portrait? DIANE
(smiling) You two. I quit. She flickers a glance at her ex husband and squeezes Les' hand. CAROLINE

...She was very impressed. She said I captured a moment like a young James Whistler. The WAITRESS brings platefuls of extravagant cheesecake t the table. Les dives in. Charles is having toast. He sips glass of water and takes a surreptitious glance at his Pa Phillippe.
TYLER
Young Whistler... good... 'cause Whistler really fell off late in his career. He's the Michael Jackson of European art history. DIANE

She suggested your sister take Pratt's Summer Art Intensive and that's hugely prestigious. Caroline looks a bit sheepish, Tyler high fives Caroline. Diane, again, flickers a glance at Charles. CAROLINE
I would be the youngest one, ever, practically... CHARLES
Tyler, would you please pass the butter? Beat. DIANE
Caroline was speaking. TYLER
(to Charles) Are you really this clueless? Are you really dismissing her like this? Diane touches Caroline's hair. CHARLES
Caroline is perfectly capable of speaking up if she is feeling dismissed. Caroline, are you feeling dismissed? CAROLINE
I'm okay. CHARLES
(solicitous, to Caroline) I didn't mean to change the subject. TYLER
What was the subject?
Excuse me?
The subject we were discussing. What was it? Beat.
Now's not the time for your heroics Tyler
No. It's the perfect time. Charles makes a minute adjustment to his collar. Father and son lock eyes until...
(whispering, to Caroline)
Do you need me to take you anywhere? Caroline shakes her head.
I'll stay with mom. Diane glares at her ex-husband. Tyler rises and kisses his sister's forehead.
Then I'll see you after school.
Kay. He exits as Caroline sips her lemonade, avoiding everybod eyes.
Tyler standing although there are a few seats available. car window strobes behind him. He takes off his jacket an button down and ties them both around his waist.

Tyler in his pants and white tee shirt looks completely o of place amidst all the business types. He sits in the last booth facing the street. His tattered JOURNAL lies open in front of him, a BINDER CLIP holds hi page as he works quietly crafting an entry. The HOSTESS, tired, in her 60's, slides a piece of baklav the table as she shuffles past.
Eat something. Tyler gives her a huge grin.
Yes, ma'am.
Tyler and his roommate, AIDAN BREWER, 22, energetic, inappropriate, walking west towards N.Y.U. Young people i easy, summery dress. Tyler smokes. Aidan doesn't. Aidan remembers something, smirks.
I sold your girlfriend a toothbrush.
You sold my who? ...What?
That voluptuous, delightfully oblivious little blonde you left in your bed this morning... I sold her a toothbrush. Got three bucks.
...Congratulations?
Are in order, yes. Because that sale inspired our newest business venture: "The S.L.U.T."
I was unaware we had a previous business venture.

The 'Single Lady's Universal Tote'. It's the one-night-stand travel pack for women. We throw in some make-up, toiletries, cell phone charger, cab numbers. Retail it at S19.95, maybe do an infomercial.
And you think women would buy this? With money?

Hey one-night-stands happen... It's a part of life... like stubbing your toe. Sometimes you misjudge a corner and bend back your pinky toe, other times you wake up in a freshman dorm wearing a field hockey tee shirt wondering why your balls smell like cinnamon...
(nodding sagely) Of course. Yes.

Don't underestimate the novelty gift market. Think about it... instead of giving that token slutty friend a ten-inch purple dildo for her birthday, you hook her up with "The SLUT." Everyone has a laugh and the implication that she'll probably use it someday remains. What do you say? Are you down?
I'm down with getting you on some sort of medication.

OK...fine...be cynical...just remember at some point in history two people had a conversation just like this about the light bulb. One of them went on to fame and fortune and the other one probably went to work at Mickey D's or something.
Or Denny's. Denny's was big in the 19th century.
A TINTED TOWN CAR stops in-front of a funky corner browns where Caroline waits in a plaid jumper on the front steps THE DRIVER opens the back door of the car.

Caroline in the cavernous backseat alone. Her pink knapsa her only company. The Town Car stops at a crosswalk for a GROUP OF CHILDREN jeans and tee- shirts on their way to a local Public Scho Caroline sees them through the tinted glass. They couldn' see her even if they wanted to.
It's an unfortunate reality but a reality nonetheless ...
TYLER sits in the back of the room. Their PROFESSOR addre the few students paying attention.

...in the wake of terrorist attacks these insurance company actuaries are provided a unique opportunity to raise premiums and profits to protect against events that will likely never occur again... One girl, a focused brunette with beautiful eyes, takes n relentlessly. She is present, absorbing the material. She raises her hand.

Isn't that also an ethical question? Tyler shoots her a glance. He takes in her lovely face, h casual dress, and the CHARM BRACELET with its four leaf clovers. WE REALIZE this is Alicia "Ally" Craig, now 19. Tyler grimaces at the question and its implications of ho
At the Alice in Wonderland statue where KIDS climb all ov the faded bronze mushroom caps and characters.

The statue is warm, the bronze absorbing the late spring Tyler is perched on the Mad Hatter, his face turned towar the sun while Caroline hides with the dormouse. Tyler lights a cigarette. AN UPTIGHT MOMMY glares at him. UPTIGHT MOMMY
Why don't we make this a non- smoking statue? CAROLINE
(emerging) Yeah, Tyler . Why don't we make this a non-smoking statue? He makes a face. CAROLINE
You promised you'd quit... TYLER
I know. CAROLINE
You're gonna get emphysema and then you're gonna have to drag an oxygen tank with you everywhere... TYLER
You think that would be the worst part about having emphysema? CAROLINE
Everywhere you go, Tyler. Even the bathroom. Tyler takes a final drag. Tosses it on the ground. CAROLINE
Why do you think Dad doesn't wanna...like, listen to me? TYLER
Dad loves you. Caroline gives him a look. CAROLINE
So? You can love someone and not want to spend any time with them. Caroline is climbing around Alice. Her hands on Alice's h
You've got that right.
Mom loves Aunt Sara. But at Christmas, last year, she wouldn't let Les leave them in a room together 'cause she said there would be a "yule tide homicide."
That's because Aunt Sara drinks... You don't drink, right?
Duh.
So why would anyone wanna avoid you? Caroline shrugs, not convinced. A silent moment passes.
Michael used to drink.
Yeah. He did. But Michael was 21. All 21 year olds drink because it's new and exciting. Aunt Sara drinks because she wishes she was 21. A shared smile.
You're 21. Tyler's smile fades.
Tyler on a rolling ladder, shuffling books around. Aidan the floor, eating two pieces of pizza, folded down the middle, at the same time.
What about Atlantic City for your birthday this year? Get a suite. Couple of ladies. You could call Toothbrush Girl, what do you think?
I think I'd rather be sodomized.
AIDAN
Hey, it's your day. He gestures to the shelves. AIDAN
What's the point? How do you know where anything is in this place, anyway? There's like... AIDAN/TYLER
"Eight Miles of Books!" TYLER
I don't expect you to appreciate this, but the schematic for this particular shelf is authors who were sleeping together... AIDAN
No shit? TYLER
And ended up dead or in prison. Beat. AIDAN
This is why chicks dig you. Tyler laughs. AIDAN
Seriously. They like this freaky poetic crap. I ran into Megan yesterday. She's bartending at Don Hill's tonight. She wants us to stop by. She practically begged me. TYLER
Eh. Aidan, visibly frustrated with Tyler's reluctance, grabs rolling ladder and pushes Tyler into the Romance novels. TYLER
Hey! AIDAN
Hey nothing. You've been a ghost the past couple weeks. You never wanna go out. I'm feeling unappreciated here. (MORE)
AIDAN (cont'd)
I can't deal with this brooding introvert shit anymore man. I'm ready to set up an intervention. A silent moment passes.
You realize interventions typically discourage binge drinking?
One drink. Come out for one drink.
When's the last time you had one drink?
A hip venue on Greenwich Street. Deejay. Music pumping. Aidan and Tyler make their way through the crowd to a congested bar where the CUTE BARTENDER is swamped.
Hey, Megan! She ignores him.
You look great! Can I get two Heinekens?
Do. Not. Speak. Tyler snorts with laughter.
(genuine)
Is she mad at me or something?
No no. Girls are like that when they're way into you.
Oh. Two nubile young GIRLS approach Aidan. Tap his shoulder.
Excuse me?
Aidan flashes a winning smile.
Well, hello...
Could you take a picture for us? She holds out her camera. Aidan hesitates, then smiles.

My pleasure... The girls pose. Aidan takes the camera. Turns it around. Extends it. Smiles. And promptly SNAPS A PICTURE OF HIMSE He casually returns the camera to the confused young woma Megan returns and practically flings the beers at Aidan.
Thanks. You've met my roommate...
I hope you die. Tyler laughs his ass off.
She's all over you. Cheers. They clink bottles.
Tyler and Aidan stand with the girls from Aidan's photo opportunity. All are thoroughly intoxicated. There is a k of CLUB GOERS halfway down the block, drinking and having fine time.
I love this street. I love this city. Where are you guys from, again?
Miami.
Miami. Miami, Barcelona, Rio. New York is it, man. God broke the mold when he made this city.
TYLER
You ever actually been to any of those places? AIDAN
What's your point? There's a gust of wind. Aidan's girl shivers. She's weari tiny dress. AIDAN'S GIRL
What are we doing? I'm freezing. AIDAN
Shoulda worn a jacket. Like me. O/S WE HEAR: a beer bottle crashing on the ground, and fr far away a ghostly, plaintive girl's voice disappearing i the night... VOICE O/S
Michael...Mi-i-chael! Tyler turns towards the sound. It's as if he's trying to a train in the distance. His hand goes to his pocket and fishes out his pack of cigarettes. AIDAN'S GIRL
(to Aidan) Asshole. She walks away, looking back at her friend, annoyed. AIDAN'S GIRL
Are you coming? Tyler's Girl looks at Tyler, who is still preoccupied. TYLER'S GIRL

(to her friend) Hold on, Lauren. The girls step away. Tyler's Girl appears to be trying to convince her friend to stay. Aidan watches them, hopefull Tyler isn't watching them. He's watching two cool looking MUSICIANS, crossing the street with the LIGHT, carrying S EQUIPMENT. A quartet of NEANDERTHALS pulls up at the light in front them in a car, aggressive music playing. The Neanderthal the wheel has the brilliant idea to rev his engine and lu the car forward, startling the musicians, toying with the
MUSICIAN #1 glares, but gives no further response, he jus wants to get across the street. The Neanderthal revs and lurches again. MUSICIAN #2 slams his hand on the hood of the car. MUSICIAN#2
What's your problem? NEANDERTHAL DRIVER
My problem? Keep your hands off my car, asshole. MUSICIAN#2
Blow it out your ass, Guido. MUSICIAN#1
Go back to Long Island. The car's four doors open, and the Neanderthals lope to t front of the car. The driver is holding a mini baseball b at his side. NEANDERTHAL DRIVER

I'm from Queens, faggot A Neanderthal shoves one of the musicians, and the driver starts wailing on the other with the bat. Tyler watches a the Neanderthals overpower them. The altercation has turn into a full on assault. The Musicians are getting stomped into the pavement. TYLER'S GIRL
So we were thinking we could go... Tyler walks right past the girl without even looking at h AIDAN

(under his breath) God damn it. Aidan runs off after Tyler. Tyler jumps fully into the thick of it, swinging, grabbin the beefiest Neanderthal in a choke hold and pounding the guy's face. He fights like a pit bull. Not feeling, not stopping. Aidan gets punched in the face. Tyler elbows the nose of guy who punched Aidan and it spurts blood. Then someone h Tyler in the gut, and he doubles over and takes a knee to chin. The musicians get back to their feet and fight back It's a brawl.

Aidan's girl is screaming for the cops. Tyler's girl, following the instincts of the inebriated, has teetered n enough to the brawl to imperil herself. A Neanderthal swings at Aidan and misses, grazing the gir She jerks away in her high heels and crashes to the pavem splitting her lip on impact. Tyler head butts the guy.

An AMBULANCE and TWO E.M.T.'S are on site. THE COMBATANTS from the brawl are lined up on the curb. SERGEANT JAMES CRAIG, a little older and heavier than whe first met him at the train station, is standing with the Girl, who is a mess. Her nose bloody, her dress torn. Craig shields the Girl with his body, listening carefully her and her friend as the two girls GESTURE ANGRILY at th Neanderthals. Craig's eyes flicker in the same direction. Craig's PARTNER, LEO, AFRICAN AMERICAN, a few years young is on the radio to Dispatch. Craig snaps his fingers at one of the E.M.T.'s and receiv blanket, which he carefully wraps around the girl. Then, his partner, indicating Tyler and Aidan...
Cut those two loose. Leo puts down the handset and uncuffs the guys.
(quiet)
Take a walk. Tyler takes a beat, looking at the lineup. Aidan, rubbing wrists, gestures "Let's go". Tyler looks at the bloodied and... Craig, going through the pockets of Neanderthal #1.
Anything in here that's going to stab me, Einstein? Craig finds a packet, or a vial.
Nice. You like to get high and hit women?
Aidan gives Tyler's elbow a gentle tug. Tyler's caught up the action. NEANDERTHAL#1
I don't even know the bitch. Rage flickers across Craig's face. Craig moves down the line to one of the musicians, going through their pockets. CRAIG
How about you two? Tyler, compelled, drawing closer to the action. MUSICIAN#1
It wasn't us, man! NEANDERTHAL#1
That cocksucker kicked my car! CRAIG
Shut up, genius. MUSICIAN#1
(to Neanderthal) Eat shit, pencil dick. CRAIG
Alright. That's it. Everybody goes downtown. Tyler steps forward, interrupting... TYLER
It wasn't them. Aidan, who has been edging away, jerks around to his frie AIDAN
(sotto) Tyler... LEO
(quietly, to the guys) Take a walk, I said. TYLER
Hey! Craig, big angry Irish cop, turns to Tyler.
TYLER
They didn't do anything. They didn't start this. Those assholes did. Why do these guys have to go downtown? CRAIG
What are you still doing here? TYLER
This is bullshit. It was those gorillas who started this. Craig moves slowly toward Tyler and starts going through Tyler's pockets, roughly. He finds his wallet. Starts rif through. CRAIG
Well, Mr. Roth. What makes you think I give a shit? TYLER
You're a police officer. You're supposed to. What the hell? Craig looks from the guy he was frisking t Tyler's girl, wrapped in a blanket. She spits blood. He t a bit to Tyler. CRAIG

It's a great relief to me, Mr. Roth, to know that you're on top of the situation. Now go the fuck home. He turns back to work. Tyler looks briefly at Aidan. Aidan looks desperate "Plea Let's get out of here!" Tyler TOUCHES CRAIG'S ELBOW. Aidan's jaw drops. Leo takes several silent steps in. Cra looks at his own elbow then looks at Tyler. The kid must out of his mind. TYLER

How about you do your job? SLAM. Craig takes Tyler's legs out, driving his face into pavement, a GASH opens above Tyler's LEFT EYE. Tyler lies there dazed and disoriented as Craig, with one knee on Tyler's neck, crushes his face into the ground. He slaps cuffs on.

Who knows what time it is. A lovely ASSORTMENT OF PERPETRATORS, Tyler and the musicians are in lockup. Everybody looks like shit. Tyler sits on a bench in the holding cell, looking quite relaxed. The lock up door slides open and Aidan is returned to the perch. The ESCORTING OFFICER shouts across the din to Tyl
You can have your call now.
I'm good. The door slides shut behind Aidan.
You're good? Thank God you're good. Beat.
What are you trying to do? What did you want from that cop guy?
That was a messed up situation. Those guys... He cups his hands to make a megaphone...
...Are pussies! From Off Screen a chorus of:
Faggot!
Candy-ass faggot!
Fag!
There was no justice in that situation.
No justice. Okay, Green Hornet ... Lantern ... Asshole.
AIDAN (cont'd)

You may not be actually matriculating in school, you may be having a nice time by yourself lurking in the stacks of your book store, but I actually plan on graduating, and having a career and a wife and a girlfriend and a divorce and a mid-life stalking episode and erectile dysfunction, and I will thank you to keep your complexes and nihilistic bullshit...
Did you just say "nihilistic"?
Yeah. I got it off a cereal box. Tyler smiles. The Escorting Officer returns with a white male LAWYER wearing a two thousand dollar suit.
Roth, Brewer. Tyler glares at Aidan.
Yeah, I called your dad's office. Sue me.
Ally, with a cup of coffee, is on the house phone.

So when would that be available?...No, that's sooner than I'd thought. And is there any kind of deposit?.. Okay. Craig comes in through the kitchen door, takes off his ja and starts washing his hands at the sink.
I'll call you back. Thanks. Ally hangs up. Makes a quick appraisal of her dad. He has little blood on his cuff. He splashes his face with water

On automatic pilot, Ally flips on the toaster, pours some coffee into a Sesame Street Mug, pours in a measured dose brown sugar from the dispenser, then flips open a bottle Aspirin and deposits two of the tablets into the mug. She packs up her back pack with school stuff as Craig gul his coffee.
What did you tell me you were going to do when things got tight? The toaster dings. She extracts an English muffin and squeezes honey from a bottle shaped like a bear.
Breathe.
Did you?
I did. I'm breathing right now. Who was that?
The lady from student housing. We talked about it. Remember? Beat.
Sure. Ally grabs her sweatshirt.
Mrs. Lippman is going to drive me.

I'll drive you. She flounces out the door, holding her own cup of coffee the English Muffin. Craig dries his hands, grabs his jack and a set of keys from the counter. 19   EXT. DRIVEWAY. Outside their red-brick row house at the end of a block o red-brick row houses. Ally has her mug on the roof of the car and is searching through her bag.
Craig comes around the driver's side and slides Ally her across the roof. She drops them in her bag.

Mrs. Lippman said she'd do it. Craig is in the driver's seat, waiting. Ally grabs her co mug and gets into the passenger seat. She hands him his English muffin, which he holds in his mouth as he starts car. She flips down the visor and checks her very light eye makeup.
You're exhausted. When you have a stroke I'm going to abandon you on a park bench. They start to back out.
This drive is too long.

Tyler and his messed up face on his feet in the waiting a English Club chairs, green baize on the walls. A RECEPTIO types away across the room. Tyler takes out a cigarette. Lights it. Draws the ire of...
You know you can't smoke in here. Tyler looks down at a heavy crystal ash tray on the coffe table in front of him. It's clearly never been used.
So what's with the ash tray?
It completes the room. Tyler takes a long drag, grinding out the ember on the pristine surface. He smiles a charming smile at the aggravated woman.
Tease.
Tyler...
JANINE, Charles' long time assistant, late forties, kind eyes, watches Tyler from the hallway.
He's ready for you.
Tyler follows Janine down the corridor. She looks him up down, doesn't like what she sees.
You're too skinny. And you smell like french fries and cigarettes.
Nice to see you too.
You want me to lie? Tyler smiles, he likes that she doesn't lie. Janine scrol through a Palm Pilot as she walks. They approach the doub doors to Charles' office.
Try not to give him a heart attack.
Okay. Tyler bangs through the doors. Janine grimaces.

A row of floor-to-ceiling windows blocked by vertical bli Sunlight glows behind them. There's a lot of leather, bra and rich wood, breathing power. There's a flat screen computer, but no personal effects anywhere. Charles sits at his massive desk. As Tyler enters, Charle registers his injuries. A flicker of something over Charl face. Tyler stands.
I came to see how much it costs, because I'm giving you the money back.
How much what costs?
That lawyer. Beat.
Ah. That lawyer, Tyler, costs 450 dollars an hour. In spite of himself...
Christ.
Tell me about it.
I wanted to make sure you understood it wasn't me who called you.
I understand. You could do worse than have a father who bails you out of jail
I don't want to be bailed out of anything. Charles looks at his son.

I'll get an invoice from Janine. Tyler leaves, slamming the door behind him. 23   INT. HALLWAY. Tyler stops, catching himself, realizing the emptiness of gesture. He looks up and sees Janine looking at him. 24   INT. WALL STREET COFFEE SHOP -- AFTER. Tyler in the same booth, surrounded by a commotion of businessmen and women. He's writing in his Journal, his f tapping fast. We see the very act of writing eases him, loosening his strangled grip on the pen, slowing down the manic rhythm of his foot.

It's just after three, Caroline emerges from school in a CLUSTER OF 6TH GRADE GIRLS. One of them dips her head tow Caroline's ear, as if to share a secret. Whatever she say makes Caroline's face crumble, almost to tears, and the g snicker. Tyler hops from his perch on a parked car. His bike leans a fire hydrant.
(to Caroline)
Hey. He looks at the girls, sizing them up, and flicks his cigarette to the sidewalk, cool as hell. The girls have a group swoon. He takes Caroline by the elbow...
Excuse us, we're due in surgery. He gets his bike and leads her down the block, towards Fi Avenue.
What happened to your face?
Horrible threshing accident.
You're so retarded.
Don't mock the afflicted. Here, I brought you something. He hands her the book of Myths.

This was my favorite book ever. Michael had it and he hit me over the head with it until I read it. Its about all these God and Goddesses who spend all of their time being jealous and petty and otherwise acting like human beings. The illustrations are amazing. Caroline opens the book carefully and has a peek. She smi
Ooh. These are cool. Thanks! Where are we meeting mom?
Guggenheim. What's up with those girls?
I just...they think I'm weird. Sometimes I sort of space out.
When you're drawing?

Yeah. Other times too. Madamoiselle Fleischman had to snap her fingers at me a lot today. And everybody laughed and they all think I'm a freak of nature. Caroline takes a brief glance over her shoulder, towards school.
Je m'appelle "Freak of Nature." Caroline smirks.
Mon dieu, mon soeurette! Je m'appelle "Freak of Nature". Sacre Bleu. French Toast.
What are you going to tell mom about your face?
I finally found something I'm good at?
Aidan appears to have cornered a PROFESSOR on her way in out of the building. The woman looks tired, annoyed, like just wants to go. Aidan talks fast, even faster than usua

...I know by every numerical measurement I didn't pass but what I was hoping was that maybe you give me a grade on my trying to pass. My commitment to effort. My commitment to commitment...Since the semester is nearly at it's terminus. Craig's car rolls to a stop just in front of the flags. A gives him a kiss on the cheek. She gets out, and walks up stairs, right past Aidan.
(distracted)
I mean... uh... life's only about what we put into it. It's about people. And what they put into it. And I'm -- ah, screw it. Aidan runs off leaving the befuddled professor on the ste
Tyler, again with the guitar. Aidan enters, excited.
He's got a daughter.
Who?
The cop... The cop who busted your face all up. He's got a daughter. And she's hot! I smell revenge!
Revenge. What do you want me to do, kidnap her?
You introduce yourself...go on a few dates...be your charming, gentlemanly self... And then, flip the script.
What does that mean?

Screw her brains out and make her call you daddy. Steal her underwear and sell it on ebay. Put her in Clown Shoes, take lewd photos and post them on her high school's home page. I don't know. Be creative.
You should be incarcerated on general principle.
Hey. What happened to you was very emasculating. Tell me you don't want to get that asshole and I'll drop it.
I don't want to get that asshole.
Just meet her.
I don't want to meet her.
She's cute.
I don't care.
You're meeting her.
I'm not meeting her.

head_text.subj: INT. COFFEE SHOP. WASHINGTON SQUARE PARK.- DAY

text: A Student Hangout. The place is bustling. Numerous NYU STUDENTS move, sit, eat, lounge. Aidan scans the crowd. T stands beside him looking far less enthusiastic.
This is one of those moments I'm already regretting.
She was here yesterday.
TYLER
What am I supposed to say to this girl? "Hey doll face, your dad trampled all over my civil liberties, wanna make out?" AIDAN
Well don't call her doll face. Ally enters. She wears a big sweatshirt. Aidan spots her. AIDAN
There. The brunette. Tyler watches her settle into a couch with a big cup of coffee. TYLER
I know her. I mean, I don't know her, but, I've seen her. She's in my global politics class. AIDAN
There you go! Something to open with. Now get over there. Tyler sighs, begins toward Ally.
Shazam! Tyler glares. Aidan gives a big thumbs up.
Excuse me? Ally briefly looks up from her book. TYLER
My name's Tyler Roth. I was wondering if I could bother you for a minute? He gives her a charming smile. ALLY
You're already bothering me. Beat. The smile usually works. TYLER
Um, I'm doing kind of a sociological experiment...I was hoping you could help me out.
Ally looks at him, a little wearily, holding her place in book. ALLY
What are you, kidding me? Tyler is genuinely taken aback. TYLER
No, I... may I ask your name? ALLY
Anonymous. It's Greek. It means "you don't have a shot". A surprised laugh escapes from Tyler. TYLER

Okay, Anonymous, do you see the guy across the room, pretending to read a text book, looking in this general direction? Aidan holds a MATH TEXTBOOK at an awkward angle to mask h obvious interest in Ally and Tyler's conversation. ALLY
Subtle. TYLER
I have this theory that an objective third-party, having no prior contact, would be able to determine how much of an asshole he is just by looking at him. ALLY
Ah. TYLER

He's my roommate. And I've witnessed so many glaring examples of assaholic behavior that I'm biased as a subject, but I'm convinced that he has an aura, that people can actually perceive. So, just take a good long look. And tell me what you think? She looks at Aidan, briefly, who shifts to avoid her gaze Then she takes a peek at Tyler's profile. ALLY
Who else do you plan on asking?
No one here. The parameters called only to sample attractive women in their early twenties.
I'm nineteen.
In their late teens. (beat)
Well, look, you typically get something for participating in these things and I've run out of those big foam fingers, so I was thinking maybe I could take you out some night? She looks at him.
Or you could just go out with me on the off chance we'd have an interesting conversation.
I don't date sociology majors... they're a rowdy bunch.
Indeed they are. Lucky for you, I'm undecided.
About what?
Everything. Tyler smiles. Ally tries to hide a smile. She closes her and extends her hand.
I'm Ally.
Caroline in art class amongst a sea of green plaid. The g work in relative silence, drawing, painting.

THE ART TEACHER walks amongst them looking over their shoulders, sees a lot of amateur art work, then she comes upon Caroline and stops. The teacher finds herself captiv by ... A COMIC PORTRAIT of Diane and Les kissing in the doorway their brownstone. Diane has a bit of a manic smile and Le half her size. Caroline notices her teacher staring. She doesn't like it shifts to block her view. The teacher gently eases her ba Smiles softly. Caroline smiles back as her teacher moves across the room Caroline has just put her pencil back to paper when... The BITCHY GIRLS we've seen before start whispering and smirking. One of them mouths...
Kiss ass freak. Caroline's smile shrinks away and she goes back to work.

head_text.subj: INT. CRAIG FAMILY HOME ALLY'S BEDROOM-- NEXT EVENING

text: Ally in sweat pants, an ancient tee-shirt, her hair in a Scrunchie, eating Mallomars from the bag and reading. Craig yells from the bottom of the stairs. He carries a b from a video store.
Don't be mad...
Dad, we've seen freaking Erin Brockovich twice already. You always cry.
I do not.
It's embarrassing. Her cell phone rings.
Hello?
Hey. It's Tyler.
Ally winces.
Hi.
You're going to stand me up. I can feel it in my bones. I'll be devastated.
No... I...I was just...
You were just sitting around in your pajamas watching T.V.
No. I'm not watching T.V. I'm just...getting dressed. She wipes her hands on her sweats, smearing them with chocolate.
And I'm going to meet you at the place at..what time again?
Eight.
Right...yes. Eight...okay. She hangs up.
Shit. She whips the Scrunchie out of her hair and heads for the bathroom. 32   INT.CRAIG HOUSE. KITCHEN. Ally comes down the stairs, putting on her earrings.
Craig looks at Ally, confused.
I'm going out.
I can see that.
Well, you're a trained investigator. She is moving quickly, grabbing her bag, her wallet. Crai tosses her keys.
Who are you going with?
A boy from school. Beat.
Okay.
I wasn't asking for permission.
(sharply)
I know. (more gently)
Have a good time. Here's cab fare. He peels off a couple of twenties.
Thanks.
Should I wait up?
Dad. Craig puts his hands in the air in surrender.
A hole in the wall Lower East Side Thai restaurant. Tyler Ally sit together perusing menus. A WAITER approaches.
ALLY
(to the waiter) What desserts do you have? WAITER
Dessert special fried bananas a la mode. ALLY
Great, I'll have that. A glass of skim milk. Then the mussels, please. Tyler and the Waiter share a look. TYLER
Pad Thai and a Sapporo. Thanks. The Waiter takes the menus. ALLY
I have my dessert first. TYLER
Is this a political statement? A medical condition? ALLY
I just don't see the point in waiting for something I know I want and am going to have. What if I die eating my mussels? TYLER
Is that probable? ALLY
It's possible. If an embolism burst or an asteroid hit the restaurant, I'd die without having eaten the thing I wanted most. TYLER
But the odds are, I mean... ALLY
Fine. I'll tell you what, you guarantee me. Swear to me on your eternal soul that I'll make it through my entree. And I'll wait. Tyler goes to answer. Ally holds up a hand.

Before you answer, keep in mind, if I die, you'll have to live the rest of your life knowing that you not only lied to me, but denied me my last indulgence. My last wish. Are you prepared to shoulder that kind of responsibility to prove a point? Tyler thinks about it. Smiles.
Don't worry. I'll share.
Tyler and Ally exit out onto the street. Tyler immediatel takes out his cigarettes, his lighter, then he notices... Ally looking at him disappointed.
Really? Tyler takes the cue puts the packet and lighter away. A b
I had a nice time.
You had a nice time or you're having a nice time? Ally considers.
Because if you're having one, why rush to end it?

They approach a CARNIVAL GAME, one those ubiquitous basketball tosses. THE ATTENDANT badgers passersby to tes their luck. GIANT STUFFED ANIMALS hang all around it. Tyler pays the Attendant, gets the basketballs. Tosses on two, the third, then nothing. Game over.
Did I tell you I'm Caucasian?
Apparently. Tyler pays again, wipes out again. Game over. Tyler pays again. Loses again. He's visibly frustrated now.
Can't we just stroll while I feed you ice cream with fireworks in the background?
No. If I stop, he wins.
Who, the attendant?
No, the frigging Giant Panda. Tyler hands the ATTENDANT another dollar.
Ally carries a GIANT PANDA under her arm. Tyler walking beside her with a self-satisfied smile.
I don't know what you're smiling about.
I won.
Paying off the attendant is not winning... It's cheating.
I just paid a premium to cut out the middle man. That's innovation. That's free market enterprising. That's what made America great.
Aha. By the way, what happened to your eye? Tyler touches the bandage.
Oh, it's nothing, just a bar fight.
How butch.
I know. I'm practically a pirate.
Okay, Captain Morgan...
(laughing)
You've got some serious timing.
It's getting late.
I'll walk you to the train.
I'll take a cab.
Tyler is just hailing her a taxi. He stands there holding door open.
Thanks. Beat. Tyler leans in to kiss her. Ally turns away.
Not tonight. Not never... just... not tonight.
We goin' or what?
Hey! Turn on the meter. Tyler respectfully leans back.
So dessert before dinner for fear of death by rogue asteroid... yes. Kissing guy you're obviously attracted to before driving off into the unknown New York night... no.
Ally considers. She gives him a quick but tender kiss.
You're really weird. She gets in the cab.
(to the driver)

I'm going to Queens and I don't wanna hear about it. Off she goes in the taxi. Tyler watches her go. 38   EXT. PRIVATE SCHOOL. THE LAST DAY OF SCHOOL. Caroline exiting with the crowd. One of the Bitchy girls shoulder checks her from behind as she passes. Tyler, wai on his perch, catches it, walks up to her.
Happy end of sixth grade!
Finally.
CHILDREN climbing all over the bronze statue. Caroline am them. She sits on a mushroom cap, letting her legs dangle Tyler watches her from their usual bench, his bike leanin next to him.
They have me in this art program summer thing at Pratt...
I heard.
It's very prestigious due to my artistic greatness.
Don't pretend. I know you're proud. You should be. Caroline allows herself a tiny grin.
CAROLINE
There's, like, a thing... TYLER
A thing? CAROLINE
(sheepish) A show where you show what you've done and stuff. Will you come? TYLER
Let me check my book. Abso-freaking- lutely. I'm camping out. I'm sleeping there the night before. Caroline is secretly thrilled. CAROLINE
You're so retarded. Mom's been hyperventilating with joy. TYLER
Good. I'm sure Les was... TYLER/CAROLINE
"Really supportive"! CAROLINE
Your school's over, right? TYLER
Yes, it's over. Did Mom and Les get the beach house again? CAROLINE
Yup. What are we going to do for your birthday? TYLER
Nothing. CAROLINE
Can we have a party? TYLER
No. CAROLINE
A little one? At Mom's? With Aidan. I'll make Mom behave. No crying. TYLER
Like that's possible.
Caroline smiles.
Ally explores Tyler's living room with a tumbler of wine. It's in a state of medium disarray. He clocks her looking
I know. But we have coasters.

I don't do coasters till the third date. She looks over his posters, pictures, etc. Tyler scans a stack of CDs, he selects Radiohead's KID A, puts it in. T hypnotic first track fills the room. Ally comes across a FRAMED PHOTO of a band on stage. The guitarist looks like Tyler with long hair.
Is that you?
That's Michael. My brother.
He looks like you... or you look like him. Does he play around here?
Not any more. Ally notices the old guitar in the corner.
Do you play?
It depends who you ask.
If I asked anybody?
They'd say no. I try but it turns out you need talent.
So what talents do you actually have?
Falconry. I come from a long line of falconers.
There's a lot of money in that. Tyler smiles. He's actually a hair nervous.
Well there is one thing... Tyler walks to the kitchen counter where a cleaned and polished COVERED CAKE STAND sits.
What's that?
Our appetizer. Tyler lifts off the cover to reveal a GERMAN CHOCOLATE CA He's written a message in the icing: "In Case Of Ast-- an then a piece has been crudely cut out. Ally's surprised.
It used to say "In Case Of Asteroid" but I took a shower and Aidan got high.
Ally and Tyler stand in front of a sink full of dirty dis up to their elbows in soapy water.
So what kind of grade did you end up with from Vogelstein?
I don't actually get grades. Beat.
I'm not technically enrolled. I worked out an auditing thing.
Oh. And The Strand is not a significant career choice.
TYLER
I like the books. He indicates the dishes. TYLER
You don't have to help me, you know. ALLY
At the rate you're going, dish washing is going to be your life's vocation. I can say I knew you when. He flicks a bit of water on her shirt. Ally takes a beat. ALLY
This is the playful, you get me all wet part? Right? TYLER
(horsing around) You make it sound so cheap. Ally's not having it. ALLY
It is cheap. I've seen this scene a hundred times. Tyler's a little confused. TYLER
I'm sorry. I didn't... ALLY
You know what never happens in this scene, Tyler-who-doesn't-really-go- to-school? Tyler-who-doesn't-really care-about-his-job? Tyler blinks helplessly. ALLY
This. An entire enormous pot of pasta water up ended on the hos Bits of spaghetti cling to him, tiny tomatoes and zucchin his shoulders like little barnacles. He sputters and gasp and blinks. ALLY
No, that usually never happens.

She calmly goes back to washing dishes. Beat. Spaghetti guy stares at her. She gives it right back to him, 100% New York City. Beat. In one move Tyler slings Ally over his shoulder. She grun unglamorously.

Tyler bursts through the bathroom door. Ally over his shoulder. Never one to waste a moment, she uses the opportunity to check out what's in his wallet. He turns o the shower. She has his drivers licence.
Apologize.

Never. Your middle name is Keats? Your parents are pretentious as hell. Tyler turns on the shower and tosses Ally into the water. dances to avoid the stream. Ally grabs the portable showe head and turns it at him. Tyler jumps into the tub to avoid the spray. They wrestle the shower head.
Apologize.

I'd rather eat monkeys. This cracks Tyler up. He stops struggling for the shower gasps a little with laughter, putting up his hands in surrender. Ally stands there, holding the shower head, giggling. They lock eyes for a moment. The air is charged. Ally spritzes him in the face.
I surrender! Oh my God, you're relentless.
He slides down the wall until he's sitting in the tub, Al follows.
Victory at all costs.
Tyler and Ally lie side-by-side, drenched. Their feet han over the edge of the tub. Tyler reaches into his pocket a removes a dripping cigarette packet. He squeezes out wate
Now... I'm furious. He tosses them in a waste basket.
You should quit anyway.
Really? Why? Are cigarettes like bad for you or something? Ally playfully slaps him. She notices the tip of Tyler's TATTOO peeking out of his undershirt.
Is that a tattoo? Let me see.
It's not really...

Please. It's very bad ass. All that ritualistic scarring. Tyler peels the soaked garment off his back as Ally offer polite applause. Michael's name becomes clear. Ally takes long look. She sees Tyler's not smiling anymore. She gets
I'm sorry... I didn't... I didn't realize. She looks at him. Asking with out asking.
He killed himself. Beat.
ALLY
When? TYLER
When he was 21. He had just started working for my father. Ally is gently picking spaghetti and tomatoes off Tyler. ALLY
I thought he was a musician. TYLER
He was. But he wasn't making a living doing music and my father's a very compelling guy. ALLY

Mine too. Ally looks away for a moment. Tucks a curl behind her ear Then they look at each other. Ally opens her mouth to spe Aidan bursts in. He's drunk, loud, wearing an Irish Flag a cape. He carries a bottle of whiskey and a can of Guinn AIDAN
Damn, you're not naked. TYLER
You're not Irish. AIDAN
T, What happened in the kitchen? It looks like somebody's water broke. (notices Ally) Hi. TYLER
Ally, Aidan... Aidan, Ally. Aidan takes Ally's hand. Kisses it. AIDAN
Don't feel bad that you're more attracted to me than you are to him it happens to all of them. Ally looks at Aidan closely, trying to figure out where s knows him from, it dawns on her. ALLY
Oh! You're the assaholic!
Well, I-- (realizes what she said)
Wait. What? Tyler and Ally laugh. Aidan's too drunk to care.
Alright, you two. Up. Dressed. Let's go. "Around The World" party on the third floor... a lot of ugly but a lot more alcohol. Let's go.
I can't, I would, I'd love to, but I've gotta get home, my dad's waiting up.
Ally. Ally. Listen to me, young lady. One drink. From any country. I'll even put France on the table. One drink. Your choice. And we're gone.
(to Tyler)
One drink?
(to Aidan)
One drink?
(innocent shrug)
One drink.
Ally VOMITS in their toilet. Tyler holds her hair back. A appears in the doorway still wearing that flag.
Hey, how we doin'? Ally tries to speak, all we hear is a series of groans. T she dry heaves again. Tyler shoots Aidan a look.
What? What do you want me to say? That I'm sorry? You want me to say I"m sorry?
AIDAN (cont'd)
You want me to apologize for showing a nice girl a good time? Is that it? Tyler just looks at him. Aidan considers.
I'm sorry.
Tyler... Tyler kneels down. Ally pushes her purse at him, she look like she's about to pass out.
I, need, you... to call... my dad. Tyler and Aidan share a look. Aidan shrugs.
Oh. OK. Sure. Tyler pulls out her cellphone - the battery is dead.
Your phone's dead. Just tell me the number and I'll call him... Tyler turns around to find Ally passed out on the floor. tries to gently nudge her awake.
Ally? Ally?
I know Ally's a good kid, Leo.
The bedside clock reads 3:47. Craig is on the phone while searching through Ally's desk drawers. For anything. He f a note book with a red cover and starts flipping through
...She was supposed to be back. She's not back ... call Ted Proferes ... and what's his face in the 9th...and call me back. Just do it, Leo! Craig hangs up the phone.
Beat. He picks it up again and starts dialing, still flipping through the notebook.
Ally wakes up alone in Tyler's bed, hung over, confused, trying to put the pieces together, then she sees the cloc And a wave of panic washes over her as she jumps out of b
...oh God oh God oh God oh God...
Tyler sleeps on the couch using Aidan's Irish Flag as a blanket. Ally comes in pulling on her shoes. Tyler stirs time to see her run out the door.
Craig sits at the table, dialing someone, anyone. Ally enters, drops her keys on the counter. Her father doesn't look at her as she pours herself a coffee.
...I'm sorry. I fell asleep... Craig squeezes honey into his coffee, practically strangl the Bear. Not looking at her. Ally notices the red notebook on the kitchen table next t the phone.
You turned your phone off.
I forgot to charge it. It dawns on her...
That's mine. From my desk. Craig says nothing. Just stirs his coffee. Ally is furiou
How could you?
CRAIG
You were gone all night. I was trying to get some information. ALLY
How could you go through my stuff like I'm a suspect? CRAIG
Then stop acting like one. ALLY
What is the matter with you, Dad? You have no respect for me and the way I'm feeling, my privacy. We talked about this! You're totally paranoid... CRAIG
You watch your mouth! ALLY
You don't do anything. You don't go anywhere except work. You have no life. CRAIG
My life is right here! In this house. The same place as yours. But you're spitting all over it. ALLY
Jesus Christ, Dad! I went on a date! CRAIG
I smell alcohol... Right back at him. ALLY
So do I. Beat. ALLY
Dad... CRAIG
ALLY

head_text.subj: YOU WANNA BURY ME IN IT

text: CRACK! He hits her, hard, open hand, from across the widt his body. Ally is knocked off balance and hits her head o the cabinets.

Ally! His face is contorted with panic and shame. Ally's disoriented. Her ears are ringing. Her lip is spli knot is starting to form where she hit her head. She straightens herself up and stares at her dad like she no idea who he is. Beat. Craig tries to envelop her. With a guttural snarl she pus him away, getting a little bit of blood on his shirt. She scrambles up the stairs.

Sunshine beats down on a little make-shift rooftop hideaw a few old beach chairs, a stereo, a weight bench. Aidan w out with an old set of dumb bells. Tyler sits on a beach chair, trying again with the guitar.
...So? She just left? No good bye? Tyler nods, strumming like he's wearing boxing gloves. Ai finishes up a set.
Maybe she heard you play the guitar.
You were the one dumping Jello shots down her throat. You almost killed her. Aidan lies down to do the bench press... there's a lot of weight on the bar.
There are sins of omission and sins of commission, my friend. I've dealt with mine and I've forgiven myself... you should do the same.
Aidan lifts. It's too heavy and falls to his chest. Tyler forgoes his spotting duty, lets him struggle. Aidan strai
...little help, T... little help, little help, lotta help... TYLER?! Tyler blows three perfect smoke rings. Finally he puts do the guitar and helps get the bar up. Aidan panting, rubbi his chest.
What the hell was that?
Penance. I have to get to work.
Tyler and Aidan come into their apartment, Aidan still rubbing his chest. Ally is standing there in the middle o the living area. A packed bag at her feet, her face a mes
I didn't know where else to go.
Aidan sits on the couch still in his gym clothes drinking protein shake out of a blender. Tyler comes out of his bedroom gently closing the door behind him.
How's she doin'?
She's pretty shaken up. Tyler takes a seat beside him. Takes out a cigarette.
We've really got to fix that dead bolt.
My bad. Sorry.
Don't be. You think she'll sleep?
You realize if she had had the
If looks could kill...
Too soon? A silent moment passes.
I told her she could stay here... Are you alright with that?
As long as she needs.
Tyler has just finished making up the ratty sofa as a bed Ally appears from the bedroom, framed by the open door. S has slept in one of Tyler's button down shirts.
You're up. Beat.
Can I get you anything? She nods.
I'll be out here if you need me. Beat. Ally takes off the shirt and lets it fall. She stands there.

We interrupt Ally and Tyler in the throes of passion. Tyl sits on the edge of the bed. Ally is on top. She kisses h neck. Suddenly, Tyler throws her to the bed. He takes control. Ally's momentarily taken aback, but doesn't stop him. There's noticeable aggression to their love-making.
In the midst of everything, the pair slow almost to stopp a caesura. They stare into each other in a moment of surp and recognition. Then again. Young, hungry, aggressive.

They lie, eyes closed, almost asleep, entwined with each other. Tyler gives a little sound of contentment. Ally, i her own haze, reaches for him, her hair all over the plac Eyes still closed they fumble for each other, starting, i this dream state, to make love all over again.

The sheets have been torn loose from the mattress. Ally l asleep, curled in the comforter. Tyler lies awake beside he smokes a cigarette and watches the sky just starting t brighten. Tyler gets out of bed. Grabs his journal. A NOTE propped up next to the bed: "Please don't leave. I be back."
Tyler locking his bike outside the coffee shop.

The place is empty. A few early RISERS get coffee to go. He sits in the same booth, his journal held open by the binder clip. He writes, a bag of Bialys next to him. Janine enters. Orders two coffees. She sees Tyler, smiles She picks up her coffees and approaches him.
I can't believe you still come down here.
Tyler looks up, grins, nods to her coffees.
It's not so far. I can't believe you still get his coffee... three sugars, no milk?
(shrugs)
Old habits. You're not writing anything bad about me, are you?
Not today.
I gotta run. Early meetings. Janine turns to go, remembers something, turns back.
I probably won't see you before Saturday so...happy birthday. Tyler nods, tries to smile. Janine glances back as she go
I'll be sure to tell your father that you said hello. Tyler nods sheepishly.
Tyler returns with breakfast. From Aidan's room, a pathet croak...
Bialy. Tyler tosses him a Bialy like he's tossing fish to a seal Ally lies on the couch. Curled in a blanket. A cup of hot in hand. She sips it. It stings her lip a little.
Hey...
Hey... Tyler sits. She shifts and curls next to him.
Where did you go?
Downtown.
ALLY
Why? Tyler pulls his JOURNAL from his pocket. Hands it to her. TYLER
There's a coffee shop. I brought you a Bialy. ALLY
New York is full of coffee shops. TYLER

This one was our place... Michael's and mine. We had breakfast there all the time ... Maybe not as many times as I think we did. But enough times. Anyway we ate there that morning. It was the last place I saw him. ALLY
Oh. So you go there to write? To him? TYLER

Maybe. Sometimes. I don't know. But I guess I wanted to tell him about you. Ally is moved, you can see it in her eyes, but she choose not to overdo it. She flips through the journal. She hand back to him. Then out of nowhere. ALLY
My mom was murdered eight years ago. The same year your brother died. Tyler is stunned. ALLY
You don't need to say anything, I know you're sorry. Everyone's always sorry, you know? He does. ALLY
It's just, I need you to know that, my dad, he's not an evil guy. (MORE)
ALLY (cont'd)

I don't want you to think that because I'm here he's some kind of belligerent psychotic, he's not...I don't know, it's just recently, he seems really... She looks at Tyler's face. His eyes are so patient. Ally tears up.
Wounded? Our house is like the recovery room, or the critical care unit or something. Tyler strokes her hair.

I don't feel like that, though. I feel like I'm getting stronger and like I'm leaving him behind to swim in it all by himself. She is weeping. Tyler pulls her to him doing the best he Holding her and kissing her hair. 58   INT. SIXTH PRECINCT -- 2 DAYS LATER. Sergeant Craig standing with a ROOKIE OFFICER, berating.
Tell me something, Matthews, do you like paperwork?
No, sir. Craig is working up a head of steam.

Me neither. Nobody likes paperwork. But paperwork keeps our ship afloat. Paperwork makes it possible for me to keep track of all the scumbags. But I can't do that if newbies like you are incapable of remembering standard filing... Leo interrupts.
Jim...
Craig snaps his head around.
...What? Leo gestures to speak privately.
Ally called Sharon.
What?
She said to tell you, she's with friends, and she's fine.
What friends?
She didn't say.
That's all? His partner nods. Craig looks away.
I'm sorry, Jim. Listen, why don't you come over this weekend? We'll get the grill going. Sharon wants to see you. We can have some people, nice people...You can circulate a little...
No.
Jim...
Leo, no. Stop. Craig goes back to his desk. Leo looks after him.
Aidan sits in the living room, trying to assemble an IKEA television stand. A joint smolders in the ashtray. The BU rings.
Aidan goes to answer it.
Hello?
Aidan, it's Diane. He blinks.
Oh, hey Diane. He throws down the keys, then yells towards the roof...
T! It's your mom. With Diane's knock the door swings open.
Hey Diane. He gives her a kiss on the cheek.

You really have to fix that door. I'm so sorry to just show up. I called but your phone was busy. Aidan looks and realizes that the phone is indeed off the hook, as just the handset, wrapped in duct tape, is visib on top of the sofa.
No problem. Come on in. Tyler and Ally enter the apartment through the fire escap
Hey mom.
Hey. I'm so sorry honey. I tried to call but...
It's okay. Mom, this is Ally. Ally, this is my mom, Diane.
Hi. Nice to meet you. Diane is thrilled. She has a huge mom grin.
DIANE
Ally. It's lovely to met you. Just lovely. Diane is pumping Ally's hand like she's drilling for oil. TYLER

Sit down, Mom. Can I get you something? She navigates the IKEA carnage and sits on the sofa, the joint smoldering in the ashtray in front of her. Aidan ev the gent, removes the ashtray to the window ledge. DIANE
Yes. Aidan, would you bring back that spliff, please? Beat.
Uh..okay. Tyler looks completely befuddled. Aidan passes Diane the joint. She takes a deep hit.
Thank you. AIDAN
How's work, Diane? DIANE
Well ... (BIG exhale) I just found housing for a family that had been in shelters for three weeks. So that's good. On the other hand, I have six other families. The women measure each other. DIANE
But Tyler, I wanted to talk to you. ALLY
Come on, Aidan.
What? ALLY
Nice to meet you, Diane.
She starts to drag Aidan out the window, back up the fire escape, but he makes a brief detour. AIDAN
Don't freaking bogart that joint, Diane.
Sorry. She hands it back to him and Aidan and Ally climb away. Tyler sits next to his mom and lights a cigarette. DIANE
Well, first, your sister is all excited about your birthday at the house. I wish you'd told me. TYLER
I wish she'd told me. It was a unilateral Caroline decision. Will you make sausage and peppers? DIANE

Of course. Tyler, Your father is driving me crazy. I shouldn't even be discussing this with you. I can't get him to say he'll come to your sister's exhibit. Her art exhibit. He says he's in the middle of an IPO. Tyler rubs his eyes. DIANE
Les says I shouldn't broker. I should let them be on whatever road they're on. Beat. TYLER
I'll get him there. DIANE
She cares about this, even though she's pretending she doesn't. TYLER
I'll get him there, mom.
You will?
Yes. She looks relieved.
Thank you. Thank you. She kisses his cheek, and rises to go. He takes her to th door.
Why don't you bring that lovely girl to your birthday?
(a warning)
Diane...

Sorry. Sorry. I love you, darling, but this place reeks of marijuana. She goes, shutting the door behind her. 60   EXT. ROOFTOP -- AFTER. Aidan and Ally on the roof, they've arranged themselves i the deck chairs.
That was weird. I assume most moms don't smoke weed in front of their son's...um
Piece of ass?
You know, you're a poet.
Hey. I know one thing. I know that in the time I've lived with Tyler, he has never introduced a girl ... woman...female...to his mom before.
It's not like he had a choice. She ambushed us.
Yeah, but he would've shoved you in a closet or something. Or literally pretended you were a hallucination.
Ha ha.
I mean it. It's the first time. Ever.
Did it ever occur to you that that's kind of weird?

No. Ally throws up her hands. 61   INT.   BATHROOM. AFTER. Tyler, having pulled the decrepit house phone into the bathroom, is leaning against the sink, girding himself to call Charles. He looks in the mirror and makes a face.
Janine pokes her head into Charles' office. Charles is swamped with work and surrounded by UNDERLINGS.
Charles, it's your son. Charles is surprised.
What?
On the phone.
Okay. He punches a button.
Tyler, you're on speakerphone.
It's about Caroline's show. Are you planning on attending?
What? There are people here. You'll have to speak up. Tyler holds the phone away from his face and screams at i silently.
Caroline's show.
What about it?
(ready to kill him)
You are coming, right?
Fine. Yes. I'm coming. We'll go to dinner first. Alright?... (to Janine)
Janine?
Dinner? That's not...
I'll make a reservation and have Janine call you. He hangs up. Tyler stares at the phone a sec, then hits h head, once, against the bathroom door.

Tyler is sitting at the table in the darkened room with A standing behind him with her hands over his eyes. Caroline enters from the kitchen carrying Tyler's BIRTHDA CAKE. She has obviously decorated it herself. She has dra (as best as she could, given the medium) the characters f the ALICE statue in frosting. It reads "A VERY MERRY UNBIRTHDAY TO YOU", and has "22" i numerical candles and "+ 1 TO UNGROW ON" written next to that.

She's singing. Aidan, Ally, Diane are all singing. There's a flash from a camera off screen. It's Les. Caroline puts the cake down in front of her brother and A takes her hands away just as they finish the song. Tyler's face in the candlelight as he sees Caroline's efforts. He takes a huge breath...
Make a wish. He looks at her and blows out the candles. Everybody applauds, Diane longer than anyone else. Her eyes are shining.
The cake totally devoured. Les is obsessively eating frosting. Caroline is trying to teach Aidan how to waltz in the liv room. He is...
Retarded. Tyler? Tyler rises from the sofa and takes over as Caroline's partner. She puts her feet on top of his feet and they wa
"One, two. three. One, two, three" Ally and Diane are washing dishes in silence. Beat.
You're the second member of this family I've washed dishes with. Beat.
He was doing it to impress you. He's never washed a dish in his life.
Caroline at her desk, sketching. Her door is ajar. Ally enters, mouth agape as she lays eyes on Caroline's collec of artwork on the walls.
Wow. Caroline's working on a PORTRAIT OF TYLER ON A PARK BENCH cigarette dangling from his bottom lip. A perfect renderi of a fleeting moment.
May I? Caroline shrugs. Ally looks over Caroline's shoulder.
That's exactly him. It's like the cigarette is the last Coca Cola in the desert. Caroline smiles.
I can't believe he smokes in front of you.
Don't worry, I'm not that impressionable. Ally smiles. Caroline goes back to work. Ally looks aroun all the portraits papering her walls. It stirs a memory.

You know when I was younger, we didn't have air conditioning in the house, so during the summer my mom and I would go to museums to cool down... she loved them all but The Met was always her favorite.
Mine too. The Met is one of my favorite places in the world.
So... I heard you've got an art exhibit coming up.
(skeptical)
You wanna come?
Was it that obvious? But only if you're OK with it. I don't want to impose and I'll completely understand if you don't want some random girl there. Caroline considers this.
You're not random... you're Tyler's girlfriend. Ally has never heard anyone say it so plainly. She seems bit perplexed, then grins. It's okay with her.
Tyler wearing the suit we met him in, it's been dry-clean Ally emerges from the bathroom, looking gorgeous in a vin black cocktail dress and carrying a pink wrap.
You like?
Let's just skip dinner and I'll tell you how great you look in like eighteen different languages.
You just want to skip dinner. I got you a tie. She hands him a simple blue tie that matches his eyes. Beat.
I was going to make a joke about how I'm not prepared for the commitment of exchanging accessories and how neck wear especially is a slippery slope, but I should probably shut up and say thank you.

You're learning. Tyler puts on his tie in the mirror. He scowls. 68   INT. FOUR SEASONS RESTAURANT -- AFTER. Tyler and Ally sip cocktails at the nicest table in the place. There's an empty seat. Tyler's eyes flicker toward the door. Twice. He touches his tie.
Have you ever been here? Ally tries to lighten his mood.
(joking)
Yeah. Every Tuesday with my pop. This goes right past Tyler whose eyes flicker towards the door again.
He's allowed to stand me up. But he's not allowed to stand you up. Or my sister. Tyler finishes his drink, signals a WAITER who glides to table.
I'll have a whiskey.
Get me one too... Like a stealth bomber. At least this moment rescued the m from actually having to greet each other.
Yes. For the lady?
I'm fine, thank you. The waiter goes.
This is Alicia Craig. Ally, my father, Charles Roth. Charles gives a courtly nod and takes her hand.
A pleasure.
An empty wine bottle. Charles cuts into a one-hundred dol steak.
You're going to be a social worker?
Yes. But with an area of focused responsibility. It's easier to find a job that way.
What will your area be?
Criminal Justice.
Tough area.
When I was little I wanted to play first base for the Mets. I don't think it's any harder than that.
The Mets, huh.
(arching an eyebrow)
I'm from Rockaway.
Dad's a Yankee fan. It has something to do with the payroll.
It has to do with significant ball playing. You were a Yankees fan when you were little. You were Lou Piniella for Halloween.
Blind familial allegiance. I didn't know what overpriced, overfed, fat bastards they were.
(serious as a heart attack) Who's fat? What Yankee is fat? Tell me.
(right back at him) It's a metaphor... Charles adjusts his tie and goes back to his steak.
Roger Clemens. Charles looks at his son. Puts his fork down. Silence at the table. Back to the steak. Beat.
Shane Spencer. Charles looks up, taken aback.
Nick Johnson. Tyler tries to get a word in.
(his mouth full of steak) He's big boned! Charles and Ally burst out laughing. Tyler rolls his eyes
Dessert. Ally is working on an enormous profiterole. Tyle another whiskey.
How long has your dad been a cop?
Twenty-two years. His cell phone lights up. Charles gently puts his hand on hers.
Would you excuse me please... I'm so sorry.
It's OK. Charles gets up from the table. Tyler, not able to help himself, shoots him a glance. Ally clocks it.
It's just a call. He held out 'til dessert. Charles returns.
I'm sorry...And your mother?
She passed away when I was eleven.
Ah.
She was murdered. I was there. Charles and Tyler are stunned to silence.
(to Tyler)
I never told you that part.
Why are you saying this now?
I don't know. The men look at her. She's a hero.
And, here you are.
Yup. Here I am. 70   INT. CRAIG FAMILY HOME. KITCHEN. There is an empty Lean Cuisine box, and two empty Beer Ca on the counter.

Craig stands by the microwave as it counts down...4,3,2,1 BEEP. He removes an Eggplant Parmigiana and slides it carefully on to a waiting plate. He takes it, along with a fresh beer, to the living room. sits heavily on the sofa and hits a remote, unpausing ERI BROCKOVICH.

head_text.subj: EXT. IN FRONT OF THE FOUR SEASONS-- LATER

text: Tyler and Ally wait in front of the restaurant as Charles takes another call. A TOWN CAR and DRIVER wait as well.
I think he's lovely. Tyler puts his head in his hands.
God. Charles returns. His face blank.
Don't say it.
I have to go to the office.
You have somewhere else to be, Dad. Charles adjusts his tie. Tyler loosens his. Ally is unsure where to look.
The exhibit runs til nine. You guys take the car. I'll meet you.
I don't believe you.
That's all there is, Tyler.
It's not good enough.
I don't have to justify anything to you. Take the car. I'll get a cab. I'll meet you.
He steps into the street to hail a cab. Tyler watches his dad get into a taxi, then holds the car door for Ally.

Amateur artwork and picked over catering. The rest of the exhibitors are high school age, even a college freshman o two. They mill with their friends and families. Animated. Ally and Aidan stand before a COLLECTION OF FAMILIAR PORTRAITS (Charles reading the paper at breakfast, Les an Diane kissing, Tyler on the park bench). Caroline sits on a catering table, Tyler next to her. She looks miserable, he looks furious. Diane bustles over wit plate of cupcakes and a big stupid grin.
I brought you every flavor. Caroline looks once at her mom then...
(to Tyler)
I'm ready to go home now. Tyler nods, takes her hand. Calls to...
Ally...? Les, eating a cupcake, and Ally, stand under a portrait o Charles. Ally picks up her purse. Diane standing there wi her cupcakes.
Tyler, visibly agitated, is letting Ally in the front doo the apartment. He grabs his bike off the wall.
Where are you going?
I have something I've got to do.
Now? Ally reaches for his elbow. He yanks his arm away.
Are you capable of taking care of yourself for an hour? Do you need me here every minute, or what? He slams out. Ally looks like she's been slapped.

Charles in a meeting with several SUBORDINATES. Everyone in late night disarray. They are obviously on their way t pulling an all-nighter. The door to the office flies open Tyler barges in. Janine trailing.
Tyler? Tyler? You can't just...
It's fine Janine. There is space between the two men. Tyler extends a rolle piece of paper to his father.
She drew you a picture.
Put it on the table. Beat. Tyler holds on to the portrait.
You have a daughter who sincerely believes you don't like her.
If I have any questions about what my daughter may believe, I'll let you know. Tyler gestures with the portrait
Don't you at least want to know her? She's telling you something, Dad. She's communicating. Why aren't you riveted? Why isn't this the most important thing? At least for one night of your life?
CHARLES
I've heard this song before, Tyler. SUBORDINATE#1
We can come back... The subordinates rise. CHARLES
It's fine, Khaleel. They sit. There is still distance between the two men. Beat. CHARLES
Who is this display for? TYLER
You, Mr. Roth. Beat. CHARLES
She knows I will take care of her. TYLER
And...? The subordinates rise again. SUBORDINATE#1
We really can come back another... CHARLES
Sit the fuck down. They sit. CHARLES
And that I love her. I love her. Good God, you toss that word around like currency. You have no idea what it means. TYLER
Maybe not. Maybe Caroline doesn't either. Where would she have learned it?
I have provided her world. And yours.
That does not mean you're allowed to shatter it whenever there's something better to do.

Who the hell do you think you're talking to? You pedaled down here on your bike for Christ's sake. You have to take care of nothing. You are responsible for no one. You're a kid. You think you're the first one to lose anything? Do you think that there is anything you feel that I haven't already felt?

You didn't find him. I found him. And you're so tragically blind, the rest of your children are going to hang themselves on your watch. Charles goes, snarling, for his son, and Tyler is more th willing. Janine and one of the Subordinates get between them.
Stop! Stop! The men are pulled apart. Tyler is white and trembling wi rage. Charles' face is completely dark and closed.

Get out of here Tyler. Tyler runs for the door. Stumbling over furniture, Caroli portrait crushed under his feet. 75   INT. RAILROAD FLAT -- RIGHT AFTER. Ally, still in her dress, trying to excavate an ice tray frozen in the ancient freezer. There's got to be six inch of frost in there. She starts stabbing it with a wooden spoon. As she hears the door, she turns and puts on her m blistering attitude like an overcoat. As Tyler walks into light-- his face white with anger, practically crying-- h eyes widen...

Oh my God. She runs to him, he falls into her. He's a mess. He won't her see his face. She pushes at his hair, trying to see a understand. He kisses her, so she won't see. Tyler is completely lost in the storm and Alicia Santana Craig is going to get him through.
Okay. She yanks his head up.
It's okay. They kiss. She brings his hands up into her hair, around face. They kiss. He kisses her like he's starved for her.
Tyler and Ally, wrapped around each other, both deeply asleep.
Craig, home from work. He hits the button on the answerin machine. There's just one message.
(on the machine)

Dad, it's me. I've been invited...I'm going away to the beach for Labor Day...They're nice people. If there's any problem I'll call. Or they will. Okay...Bye. As he takes off his jacket, Craig hits rewind and plays t message again...
(on the machine)
Dad, it's me...
Raucous laughter. Caroline, Tyler, Les, Ally and Aidan ar the living room playing charades.

Everyone is a little sunburnt, the adults are a little dr Ally is wrapped up in Tyler, Caroline is on her mom's lap the floor, Les next to them, lying on his stomach. Aidan up and God only knows what he's doing LES
(totally flabbergasted) I genuinely have no idea...are you having a seizure? CAROLINE
Time. AIDAN
Berlin Alexanderplatz! More raucous laughter. AIDAN
You people are culturally bankrupt. TYLER
Whose was that anyway? CAROLINE
Mine. Whoops of laughter heretofore unheard in Montauk. DIANE
Okay, you. Bed. LES.
Me? Yeah, baby. CAROLINE
Gross. Gross. Gross me out the door. She rises and flees into the kitchen. Les rolls over and up with his head in Diane's lap. He looks at her for a moment. LES
You're just the prettiest girl. Diane beams at him. Tyler smiles at his mom and Les, then at Ally. Diane take deep look at her son. Her eyes shining. AIDAN
Holy crap. What's with all the smiling?
Caroline travels through the living room with a popsicle. is headed for her bedroom.
A child could do Berlin Alexanderplatz, you spaz. Les snorts with laughter. Diane rises, dumping him to the floor.
Hey!

I want five minutes with my child before she ceases to be a child and decides I'm ruining her life. On her way out, Diane pauses and gently pushes one of All stray curls behind her ear. Smiles down at her.
Aren't you a treasure. Ally stares up at Diane for a beat, her eyes shining.
Tanned and rejuvenated, Ally, Tyler, and Aidan sit togeth on the train back to the city. Ally and Tyler kiss. Aidan watches them.
I want a girlfriend.
What?
Dinners out, movies. Regular sex. That could be all right. For like, a summer.
You're such a romantic.
And I've had all the races.
Excuse me?
AIDAN
I've had all the races. I've been with girls from every...race. Ally laughs. TYLER
That is the stupidest thing you've ever said, including that time with the bong in the emergency room. ALLY
White girl. AIDAN
Please. Like falling off a log. As a matter of fact... ALLY
Shut up. Black girl. AIDAN
But of course. ALLY
Asian. AIDAN
Twice. ALLY
Latina. AIDAN
Oui! ALLY
A Latin girl actually slept with you? What's her name? She's out of the club. Tyler is laughing. Ally thinks for a moment. ALLY
Eskimo. Aidan gives a satisfied smile. TYLER/ALLY
No way! AIDAN
Monica Ipellie. She works at the Public Library on 96th street.
ALLY
You slept with an Eskimo? TYLER
You went to the library? The car doors open and a MAN ushers his family through. Craig's partner Leo, in plain clothes. AIDAN
Inuit. In-u-it, Ally. Try not to show your ignorance. ALLY
I don't believe you. AIDAN
Fine. Nice girl. While we were doing it, I couldn't get this little, like, song out of my head... He begins to bob his head to a rhythm. AIDAN

"Inuit, bum buh bum, I'm banging an Inuit, bum buh bum buh bum..." Ally and Tyler collapse in laughter as Craig's Partner pa He notices Ally immediately. She doesn't see him. He take long look at Tyler as he follows his wife and kids into t next car. ALLY
Prove it. Ten bucks. The train makes a stop at Patchogue. Leo and family disembark. AIDAN
You wanna go to the library? ALLY
The minute we get off this train. AIDAN
Fine. ALLY
Tyler, are you coming? TYLER
I'll skip this particular bloodbath, thank you.
Tyler, his bag on his shoulder, returning home, fishing i his pocket for his keys. He sings the Inuit song to himself...

bum buh bum bum buh bum buh bum... His front door is unlocked. Tyler freezes. Takes a beat. Scans the room, silently dropping his bag. He reaches behind him for the aluminium against the door. Wielding it, he takes two steps into th apartment. Craig, in plain clothes, sitting on Tyler's bed, amidst t carnage of Tyler's stuff. He has been rifling through everything. The guitar is propped haphazardly against the wall. Craig looks up. The men lock eyes. Craig's eyes go to the bat. Tyler leans it slowly against the wall. Beat.
Where is she?
What are you doing in my house? Craig's eyes flash.
Where's my daughter?
She's not here now. She's at the library. Craig's face says it: "Bullshit".
Does she know? Cops never ask a question they don't know the answer to.
No.
CRAIG

I didn't think so. I figured you'd probably leave that up to me when you're done with her. Craig's face, like his wife's so many years ago, is pure contempt. With his body at this angle, Tyler can now see gun. TYLER
I'm not going anywhere. CRAIG

That's true, Tyler Roth, son of Charles and Diane. Brother of Caroline and Michael, deceased, suicide by hanging. You're kinda lost, aren't you? Taking a little vacation in coach before finding your way back to first class? TYLER
