I'm the one she came to when you used her face as a punching bag. Craig closes the distance. From Tyler's P.O.V he looks like a freight train. In a flash, he gets Tyler in a choke hold, flips him on h back on the bed and puts his hands around Tyler's throat. Silence, except for exertion. Tyler's hands are on Craig's wrists. He is holding Craig' eye. His face is starting to turn colors. Beat. Beat. TYLER

She needs you. It travels between the two men. Craig grappling with it, although he still has his hands at Tyler's throat. Craig drops his hands, pushes himself off Tyler Tyler rolls to one side, coughing and gagging. Craig leans against the wall for support.

He is trying, before our eyes, to pull the shards of hims together. His gun visible at his waistband. Tyler's coughing, his face still red, his eyes travel bri to the bat, then to Craig. Craig closes his eyes, very briefly, then rises. Not look at Tyler. Beat. Looking at Tyler. Beat. Craig goes to the front door.

Get a fucking dead bolt. Slam. And then he's gone. The door bounces in its frame. then it's just Tyler trying to remember how to breathe. 81   INT. RAILROAD FLAT-- LATER. Tyler smoking, standing at the window, waiting for Ally. sees her walking up to the front door. He grinds his cigarette out. Ally is running up the stairs
Tyler Keats Roth! She arrives at the door.
He banged an Inuit! She's really nice. And smart. I don't get it. Beat.
What's going on?
Your dad was here.
(panicking)
What?
When I got home.
Beat. ALLY
I hate him! She lunges for the phone. Tyler stops her hand. TYLER
There's more. She looks like she's starting to panic. TYLER
He knows me. Before I met you. He arrested me and Aidan. He gave me that gash over my eye. ALLY
I don't understand. TYLER
I mouthed off to him. He ... responded. Then Aidan saw you guys together at school. She isn't quite getting it. TYLER
Aidan suggested...I...introduced myself to you. She's got it. Beat. TYLER
Ally... ALLY
I'm going to be sick. She bolts from the chair to the sink and dry heaves. Tyle reaches out to comfort her. TYLER
Hey. She reels around and cracks him across the face. Not like chick. Like her dad. The sound hangs in the air. Ally goes to the bedroom and starts throwing her stuff in bag. Tyler follows her.
Don't do that. What are you doing?
Do you realize what you've done?
Yeah. He doesn't.
Did you think I would never find out? I mean, think about it. I had to find out eventually. You set it up that way.
But it doesn't mean anything. I didn't mean to hurt you,
No. That's exactly what you meant to do. She pushes past him and out the door.
Ally heads down. Aidan heads up. He smiles wide.
Hey. Ally pushes past him.
Prick.

head_text.subj: INT. RAILROAD FLAT-- LATER THAT NIGHT

text: Tyler sitting on the ratty couch. Aidan eats old Chinese from the container. He offers some to Tyler. They sit in silence. Tyler swelling. Aidan eating.
You had to tell her eventually... This is no comfort.
Glass half full... you just saved yourself an awkward Thanksgiving. Sincere now.
She'll be back, T. Tyler heads into his bedroom and shuts the door.
Sergeant Craig working on a sink full of dirty dishes. He scrubs at a filthy pan with a piece of steel wool. He's m but there's not a beer can in sight.
You know you're not supposed to use that on non-stick pans... Craig turns, finds her there in the doorway, bag at her f
It takes off the teflon. They stare at each other for a moment.
You should let it soak.
Okay. They look at each other. Craig tries a smile. Ally's cool with him. Moving towards him, past him.
I'm going upstairs.
Caroline and Diane walk up to the DOORMAN. Caroline carri gift, a sleeping bag. Diane smiles at her daughter.
Stop smiling. You look insane. Diane can't help it try as she might.
I'm sorry, honey. I just... it's nice. Like an end of the summer send off. Caroline rolls her eyes.
Have fun. Caroline goes into the lobby. Diane heads back to her car

Caroline gives her gift to THE BIRTHDAY GIRL who smiles. follows her into the next room where the other PARTY GUES watch a movie. They all turn and look at Caroline. Caroline smiles sheepishly. Some of the MEAN GIRLS are th One of them gives her a perfunctory smile.

Jackie Chan's foot slamming through a wall. Tyler and Aidan are watching RUSH HOUR 2. Aidan slurps from a super mega sized soda, laughing, enjo himself. He turns to his friend. Tyler sits, completely drained, looking like the loneliest guy on the planet. Aidan gives him a nudge. Tyler looks at the screen for a and half smiles, then slips away again. Aidan is genuinel concerned.

The party girl's MOM is in a bathrobe. She looks horrifie she has one hand covering her mouth and is whispering int cell phone. Caroline is on the kitchen phone. Her long ha has been CUT TO PIECES while she slept. She is crying.
(into the phone)
Mom?
Ally and her father cook breakfast together. There's a kn
Aidan paces nervously. Craig appears in an apron. Aidan smiles.
Hi. Beat.
Is this the, uh, that is, does, uh, Alicia Craig. Does she live here? Craig nods.
Oh great. I'm...
You think I don't remember you?
No, sir.
Who is it Dad? Ally sees Aidan. She touches her father's forearm.
It's OK... Craig steps back into the house. Six inches.
Really. He backs into the hall. Aidan and Ally are alone.
What do you want?
Look, I'm a prick.
And... Craig popping back like an eel from a wreck.    He's got mangled Honey Bear.
Dad...
He goes again. Pfft. Aidan's visibly relieved.
Tyler's not. She starts to close the door.
Wait. Shit. This isn't really my thing.
He lied to me.
He's in love with you.
He'd like to think he is. Aidan doesn't get it.
I don't know what that means...I've seen him look at one other girl the way he looks at you. She's a lot shorter and shares his DNA. Ally looks away.
You don't have to forgive him today... just forgive him. Craig reappears from the deep.
Thanks for stopping by. Father and daughter go back into the house. Aidan exhales.
Diane is on the house phone, preparing a tray of tea and cinnamon toast for Caroline as she talks.

Are you telling me, Ms. Spencer, that you intend to let those girls stay in your school?...Of course they're all sticking to the same story and that story is a load of crap!... She slams a cabinet closed as Les picks up the tray and W TRACK HIM down the hall to CAROLINE'S ROOM. Les is speaki on his cell phone.
(sotto, into the phone)

She's pretty traumatized. I wanted to pull some names together in case we all decide she should talk to someone... 92   INT. CAROLINE'S BEDROOM. Caroline and Tyler are lying on Caroline's bed. Her head nestled on his shoulder. She looks even tinier than usual Tyler is reading to her, softly, from The Book of Greek Myths, his other hand stroking her butchered hair. She looks pale, wasted. Her eyes are sunken and she's fighting sleep. A losing battle, she's exhausted. Her lid finally shutter to the sound of her brother's voice. Les, at the door, places the tray on Caroline's desk...
(on the phone)

There's no witnesses and it didn't happen on school property. The school won't do anything. They'll probably get away with it... Tyler's eyes, registering anger and shock, jump from the as he hears this. 93   INT. FOYER. Diane opening the front door for Aidan and Ally. Aidan wr his arms around Diane and gives her a hug. Ally hangs bac bit, unsure, then embraces Diane. Tyler emerges from the hallway.

She's asleep. He sees Aidan and Ally. Stops short.
Tyler alone on the top stair, taking long pulls from a cigarette. Ally comes out the front door, softly closes i behind her.

I know you're not here for me but, thank you for being here. A silent moment passes.
For what it's worth, I think you're amazing.

Okay. Now what? I'm supposed to just forgive you? A BMW 7 Series speeds around the corner. Stops in front o the house. Charles gets out of the car, sees his son.
How is she?
She's sleeping. Diane emerges from the house. Charles strides quickly tow her.
Caroline asleep in her bed. Charles stands in the doorway watching her sleep, we get the feeling he hasn't seen her asleep in some time. Diane appears at his side.
How long do you think she'll sleep?
I think she'll be out for a while. Would you like to wait?
Thank you. I can't. I'll call her later.
I'll tell her. Diane looks at Charles. He's still watching his daughter.

Caroline's TEACHER prepares her lesson plan. She starts t write the date on the board when The door opens. Caroline Tyler enter. The entire class is watching. A JANITOR pushes a flat broom down the empty corridor whe the glass from one of the classroom doors explodes as the desk makes impact. He stops pushing the broom and stares.
Pin-drop silence. The students sit paralyzed. Tyler stare the Mean Girl. Her arrogance completely gone. Caroline st up at her brother, awestruck.
TYLER locked up among CRACK HEADS and PETTY CROOKS on a d bench with his hands behind his head and a bemused smirk. BAILIFF approaches the holding cell. Looks at Tyler.
You posted.

Charles standing in the waiting area. Tyler is led out by bailiff rubbing his wrists. He sees his father, his face registering surprise. Beat. The men walk together towards the exit in silence. Neithe looking at the other.
Destruction of private property and felony trespassing.
I didn't call you.
I know you didn't. Charles stops.
I have unleashed a raging shitstorm of epic proportions on the board of trustees of that pissant school that will not abate until those girls seek enrollment elsewhere. I give them a week.
Beat.

Can you come by the office to talk to the lawyers?
Beat. Tyler deciding. Tyler nods. Charles appraises his son.
Try not to vandalize any more schools in the meantime.
Charles walks ahead, pulling out his cell phone. Tyler calls after him.
Thank you for bailing me out.
Charles, without turning around,
No problem.

Tyler leaning against the bike rack, waiting. He sees All running up the steps and watches her as she blends into t crowd. 102   EXT. WASHINGTON SQUARE PARK -- JUST AFTER. No mimes, just dealers. Ally with a girlfriend, walking towards the East Side. Tyler catches up to her.

Shakes the friend's hand. After a beat, Ally agrees to wa with him. He reaches for her hand. She pulls it away, but walks next to him. 103   EXT. CENTRAL PARK -- ALICE STATUE -- JUST AFTER. Beat.
Using the little sister is dirty pool.

Is it working? Beat.
Maybe. Tyler has a smile the size of New York City. Ally smiles back.
Bright sun pouring through the window. Ally lying asleep. Tyler is up and dressed now, he grabs his journal off his desk, kneels beside Ally. He is bathed in the pool of lig streaming in.
(nuzzling)
Hey...Hey.
Hmmm.
I'll be back in an hour. I have to stop by my dad's office.
(sleepily)
Do you want french toast or pancakes for breakfast?
Whichever tastes better a la mode. Ally smiles.
Say hi to your dad for me. Tyler watches her lying there.
If I said I love you... what would you say?
(laughing)
I love you.
I love you too. Tyler kisses her. Then heads out into the...
Aidan passed out on the couch still wearing the clothes h went out in the night before. Tyler watches him sleep.
(without opening his eyes)
French toast. Tyler smiles as he takes his journal and exits.
Charles waiting on the doorstep, his Town Car waiting on curb. Diane answers the door expecting to find Caroline's driver, she's confused to find...
Charles?
Good morning Diane.
What are you doing here?
Tyler's coming by the office, but I thought I'd ride to school with Caroline first.
Diane is speechless. This is a first.
Um...OK...sure...yeah...great. She's not ready though, she's going to need at least twenty minutes.
Charles hates waiting.
(adjusting his tie) All right.
Tyler chaining up his bike. His cellphone rings. He check it. Knows what it's regarding before he answers.
Are you canceling all together or are you just running late?
Charles and Caroline in the back seat. She's on one side, with her pink back pack, he's on the other.
(on the phone) Are you already on your way?
Tyler rounding a corner.
I'm already here.
I'm taking Caroline to school. He looks at his daughter. She looks back at him, then loo out the window. Tyler considers.
Take your time. I'll just wait in your office.
It may be a while.
That's okay. Tyler hangs up and joins the herds of suits heading down street.
Tyler riding in a handsome marble and oak elevator with a half-dozen EXECUTIVE types. Tyler steps on and presses th number 92. The doors close.
Tyler walks, approaches the Receptionist from the ashtray incident. He smiles pleasantly. She doesn't.
Janine in?

She went for coffee.
She getting me any? Just kidding. Tyler heads down the hall. The Receptionist rolls her eye
Tyler steps into his father's empty office. It's dark, qu He opens the blinds. Sunlight fills the room.

Tyler walks around the office. Picking things up, putting them back. Tyler sits at his father's desk in his executive chair. H leans back. Puts his feet up and his hands behind his hea Tyler notices the COMPUTER. He turns on the monitor and p his hand on the mouse - but doesn't move it. His hand jus stops and stays perfectly still. Tyler stares at the moni where his dad's SCREEN SAVER is scrolling through PHOTOS. These photos are all of his FAMILY... "Michael's first Christmas, Tyler's eighth birthday, Diane in the hospital with Caroline in a pink blanket, Charles and his kids bui sand castle at the shore"... they just keep going. Tyler finds himself watching a slide show of his life.

That line of luxury cars dropping their daughters off. Charles' Town car rolls to a stop. Caroline gives him a k on the cheek. It registers, sort of. She gets out. Charle watches her all the way into the school. His DRIVER sees him watching Caroline in the rear view mirror. Charles gives the Driver a look "you're waiting for an invite?" The Driver peels out.
Ally has made a mess making french toast. Aidan is yakkin his phone.
Charles in traffic. All around him DRIVERS curse, honk, h each other. Charles rides, not letting it bug him.
Caroline drawing at her desk as her Teacher comes in and ready to start the day.
Tyler is still watching the screen saver when Janine ente
Good Morning, Mister Roth.
Did you know about this? Janine walks around the desk in time to see a photo of Ty and Michael naked in the tub pop up. She smiles.
Who do you think scanned all the pictures? Tyler smiles. Janine smiles, Then a photo of Michael come up. Those smiles fade. Silence.
How old would he be?
Twenty-nine last May. Tyler stands and looks out one of the floor-to-ceiling windows separated by columns. He stares out at mid town a perfect blue sky. Janine looks befuddled.
It's really been that long? I could've sworn it was...
May 18, 1993. A silent moment passes. Janine reflecting.
I should be able to remember that. I'm sorry. Tyler looks at her, his face easy...
It's okay.
Caroline's Teacher writes the date on the board as Caroli sits quietly doodling. The teacher looks her way.
Caroline? Hello? WIDE SHOT of the blackboard. It's unmistakable: SEPTEMBER 11, 2001

We're now looking at Tyler from just outside Charles' off window and we're PULLING BACK... Until we see Tyler framed in the window surrounded by eer familiar grey metal siding... Until we see can barely see Tyler and the base of a giant white antenna... Until we can no longer see Tyler as he's disappeared into composite of the building and we've pulled back far enoug reveal that Tyler is standing in a window on the... 92nd Floor of The North Tower of the World Trade Center. A moment of still perfect silence. The Towers. The blue s Then we hear the faint sound of AA Flight 11's ENGINES as closes in on the North Tower.
Silence. Darkness. We wait in it.
Whatever you do in life will be insignificant but it is very important that you do it because...
Charles Roth steps out of his car. His gaze fixed skyward All around him the other DRIVERS mimic his behavior.
It's a good bet...
Diane sweeping cigarette butts off the stoop.
Nobody else will...
Diane joins a group of ONLOOKERS staring up from a street corner in Brooklyn where the black smoke stains the blue One of them has a radio to his ear.
Michael... Diane staring at it.
Someone's been trying to tell me something.

Maybe it's you...
Aidan and Ally absolutely frantic on the roof. Holding ha Craning to see. Ash begins to float down on them. It gets caught in Ally's hair.
This girl! Ally! Her life, even the nightmare parts seeped into me and I swear to God I can hear you better.

THE PAPER, so much of it, all of it singed, smoke-stained falling like snow flakes coating the streets and the sidewalks. Amongst the memos and faxes that will now neve sent and never received we find...
Someone comes into your life...

June 17, 1978 September 11, 2001 Charles, Caroline, Diane and Les approach the tombstones. family mourning. Diane slips her hand through Charles' el The gesture seems quite natural, easy.

And half of you says "Danger! Stay in your cave! You're nowhere near ready!" Caroline has come to the end of her rope with her dad. Sh grabs his phone and throws it into the fountain, spins on heel and marches into the auditorium. Charles is complete thunderstruck.

And the other half -- and this is the part I think is you -- He is torn between his phone and his daughter for a sec, chooses Caroline and takes off after her... ...then comes running out by himself to rescue his phone.
Craig is wearing a jacket and tie. He's on a date with a pretty WOMAN. In his confusion over the menu, he knocks o a glass of water.
Says "Go get her! Immediately! Make her yours forever!"
A chaotic place, filled with folk who need help. Diane at desk, organizing families.
I'm working on the forever part.
Aidan actually awake in class. He has a tattoo on his forearm. "Tyler".
I'm going to have to step up my game. But I'm glad I listened.
Ally, we find her as we first found her mother, silhouett against the Lower Manhattan skyline where two beams of pu light reach up forever where the Towers once stood.

I love you. Her train pulls into the station. Ally boards with a few other commuters. She takes a seat by herself across from. A MOM and A TODDLER, a little girl. The baby is squirming impossibly, the mom looks exhausted. Ally watches them, remembers him, as the faintest hint of smile crosses her lips the subway lights flicker and we..
